page.title: 02Fordoun Village
page.content: Fordoun village used to be known as Fordoun Station because this was the only place the trains stopped in the parish of Fordoun. The village grew up only because of the station and the first buildings were erected in Station road. About the beginning of the century houses were built in Springbank Terrace. Half the houses in the village were built from 1960 to the present day. These houses lie in Toch-hill Road and Redhall Place. Old Fordoun - The sation house was built around 1836. it was clsed in the 1960's. The post office has been here since at least 1867. letters are no longer sorted there but nowadays the shop also sells groceries. The baker's shop, cobbler, saddler, smidy and sweet shops are all now houses.
